analyzed: des dge slong rnams dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro; ;gal te gnas mal dang / nad kyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad rnams rab tu phal che ba dang ldan par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If they do not have an abundance of bedding, medicine for the sick, and other necessities,

original: de thams cad du'ang dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thams cad du'ang dge ba'i chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not delight in the virtuous qualities.

original: de ltar chos rnams ni /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams ni /
translated: In this way, phenomena🔽are mutually produced, mutually dependent, mutually generated, and mutually caused.

original: gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pa dang / phan tshun du ltos pa dang / phan tshun du skyed par byed pa dang / phan tshun gyi rgyu can gyi don gzhan du gyur pa'i byed pa po dang / rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pa dang / phan tshun du ltos pa dang / phan tshun du skyed par byed pa dang / phan tshun gyi rgyu can gyi don gzhan du gyur pa'i byed pa po dang / rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang /
translated: They are not created by any other agent, and they are not permanent, stable,

original: ther zug dang / yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: ther zug dang / yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams gang yin pa'am /
translated: enduring, or unchanging.🔽They are not created by any of the causes that are included among the causes, nor are they created by any cause that is not included among the causes.

original: rgyu rnams kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu med pa rnams kyis kyang kun kyang skyed par 'gyur ba la shin tu 'bad par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu med pa rnams kyis kyang kun kyang skyed par 'gyur ba la shin tu 'bad par byed pa ni /
translated: Those who make great efforts to create them

original: 'di na mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di na mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: But this is not so.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner carefully considers and attends to the external body.

original: ji ltar khams gsum du skyes par gyur pa'i sems can thams cad kyang phyi rol gyis don gcig par gyur pa'i phyi rol gyi las gang gis nang gi bdag nyid kyi @268b chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin no //🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: ji ltar khams gsum du skyes par gyur pa'i sems can thams cad kyang phyi rol gyis don gcig par gyur pa'i phyi rol gyi las gang gis nang gi bdag nyid kyi @268b chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin no // des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: How does the external body of all sentient beings who have taken birth in the three realms increase the internal phenomena of their own selves through external actions?

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

original: 'du byed par skyes pa'i sems can thams cad kyi chos gcig tu gyur pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed par skyes pa'i sems can thams cad kyi chos gcig tu gyur pa ni /
translated: he will notice that there is one phenomenon that is common to all sentient beings who are born through the process of formation.

original: zas gang dag yin pa rnam pa bzhi po kham gyi zas dang / yid la sems pa dang / reg pa dang / dga' ba dang 'di dag rnams yin no //
analyzed: zas gang dag yin pa rnam pa bzhi po kham gyi zas dang / yid la sems pa dang / reg pa dang / dga' ba dang 'di dag rnams yin no //
translated: That is the four types of food: physical food, intention, contact, and consciousness.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams rnams na ni; zas 'di dag rnams gang yin pas sa bon gyi tshogs byas nas phyi rol gyi zas de dag gis kyang nang gi bdag nyid kyi bsam gtan la bde bar gnas pa rnams 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams rnams na ni; zas 'di dag rnams gang yin pas sa bon gyi tshogs byas nas phyi rol gyi zas de dag gis kyang nang gi bdag nyid kyi bsam gtan la bde bar gnas pa rnams 'phel bar byed do //
translated: In the desire realm, these foods create the collection of seeds, and those external foods also increase the inner bliss of concentration.

original: de la dang po nyid du re zhig phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de la dang po nyid du re zhig phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: First, one should contemplate external phenomena.

original: ji ltar nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos de dag rnams phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis 'dzin par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos de dag rnams phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis 'dzin par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do those inner phenomena apprehend external phenomena?

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag dang / gzhi ci las gang gi tshe bzang ldan gyi dus kyi srog chags rnams thams cad kyi zas yin na yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag dang / gzhi ci las gang gi tshe bzang ldan gyi dus kyi srog chags rnams thams cad kyi zas yin na yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa rnams yin no //
translated: Through the wisdom that arises from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, one sees that when the eight factors are present, they become the food of all beings in the world of Kāliṅga.

original: de la yan lag brgyad po de dag rnams kyang gang dag yin na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yan lag brgyad po de dag rnams kyang gang dag yin na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the eight limbs?

original: 'dod pa'i sgra dang / reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang dri dang / 'dod pa sdug pa'i khu ba 'thas pa'i mdog dang / dbyibs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra dang / reg bya dang / ro dang / gzugs dang dri dang / 'dod pa sdug pa'i khu ba 'thas pa'i mdog dang / dbyibs so //
translated: They are sounds, textures, tastes, forms, smells, and the color and shape of the fluid that is the essence of desire.

original: de la gal te mal stan dang nad kyi rkyen sman dang yo byad rab tu phal che bar gyur pa'i phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis lus @269a *//🔽'phel bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la gal te mal stan dang nad kyi rkyen sman dang yo byad rab tu phal che bar gyur pa'i phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis lus @269a *// 'phel bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the body is nourished by an abundance of external things such as bedding, medicine, and other supplies,

original: de'i tshe na nang gi bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i chos rnams la yang mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na nang gi bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i chos rnams la yang mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the internal wholesome factors will also flourish.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: In this way, the spiritual practitioner carefully considers the external body and attends to it.

original: phyi rol gyi sbrang bu mchu rnon dang / sha sbrang dang / grog ma phra mo la sogs pa rnams kyis gal te lus la mtho 'tsham par mi byed na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sbrang bu mchu rnon dang / sha sbrang dang / grog ma phra mo la sogs pa rnams kyis gal te lus la mtho 'tsham par mi byed na /
translated: If the external body is not harmed by mosquitoes, horseflies, bees, or biting insects,

original: de las nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la yang mngon par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la yang mngon par 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and then he will be interested in the inner phenomena.

original: gal te yang grang ba dang dro ba dang char pa la sogs pa rnams kyis lus la mtho 'tsham par mi byed na; de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la mngon par spro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang grang ba dang dro ba dang char pa la sogs pa rnams kyis lus la mtho 'tsham par mi byed na; de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la mngon par spro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If cold, heat, rain, and so on, do not torment his body, then he will be interested in the inner phenomena.

original: gal te yang 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnar snyan par gyur pa'i sgra rnams thos par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnar snyan par gyur pa'i sgra rnams thos par gyur pa na /
translated: If he hears pleasant, attractive, and delightful sounds,

original: de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then he will be interested in the inner phenomena.

original: gal te 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba'i dri rnams kyi dbang du gyur pa na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba'i dri rnams kyi dbang du gyur pa na /
translated: If he smells pleasant, attractive, and delightful scents,

original: de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then he will be interested in the inner phenomena.

original: gal te grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char pa la sogs pa lus la co ma dris na /
analyzed: gal te grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char pa la sogs pa lus la co ma dris na /
translated: If cold, heat, rain, and so on, do not torment his body,

original: de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, one will delight in the inner phenomena.

original: dbang po lnga po rnams gal te rgyas par byed pa'i phyi rol gyi skye mched lnga po rnams kyis nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched lnga 'phel bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga po rnams gal te rgyas par byed pa'i phyi rol gyi skye mched lnga po rnams kyis nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched lnga 'phel bar gyur na'o //
translated: When the five outer sense-spheres that cause the five inner sense-spheres to increase are increased,

original: de ltar @269b phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar @269b phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: In this way, one should observe the external body and abide in it.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The sons of good family who abide in the Great Vehicle,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
translated: and the noble śrāvakas, should also understand the body as it really is.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully observes the external body and abides in it

original: ji ltar bdag gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug chos rnams la dga' bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug chos rnams la dga' bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: will think, “How do the six collections of consciousness delight in phenomena?

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or through the divine eye,

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: The divine eye sees

original: gal te phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis mtho brtsams par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyis mtho brtsams par ma gyur na /
translated: that if external phenomena do not rise up,

original: de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams rang bzhin du gnas pas chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams rang bzhin du gnas pas chos rnams la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then internal phenomena remain in their natural state and one delights in phenomena.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po de dag rnams kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po de dag rnams kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six collections of consciousness?🔽They are the eye consciousness, the ear consciousness, the nose consciousness, the tongue consciousness, the body consciousness, and the mind consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams so; ;de ltar nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams kyi phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dang lhan cig phan tshun gyi dbang du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams so; ;de ltar nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos rnams kyi phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dang lhan cig phan tshun gyi dbang du gyur pa dang /
translated: Thus, internal phenomena and external things mutually influence each other.

original: phan tshun 'grogs pa yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'grogs pa yin te /
translated: They are mutually connected.

original: dper na / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dper na / 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bya nam mkha'i dkyil du song bar gyur nas rab tu rgyu bar byed pa de gang dang gang du ji ltar nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dang de dag rnams su 'di'i grib ma de kho na bzhin du dbang du gyur nas @270a *//
analyzed: bya nam mkha'i dkyil du song bar gyur nas rab tu rgyu bar byed pa de gang dang gang du ji ltar nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dang de dag rnams su 'di'i grib ma de kho na bzhin du dbang du gyur nas @270a *//
translated: The bird flies in the middle of the sky and moves about. Wherever it goes in the sky, its shadow follows it in the same way.

original: 'gro'o; ;de kho na bzhin du phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi dbang gis nang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams thams cad yin no //
analyzed: 'gro'o; ;de kho na bzhin du phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi dbang gis nang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams thams cad yin no //
translated: In the same way, all internal things are under the power of external things.

original: gal te lus thams cad rgyas par gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te lus thams cad rgyas par gyur na ni //
translated: If the whole body is expanded,

original: de las kyang sems rnam par nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang sems rnam par nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the mind does not become weak.

original: des na thams cad kyang phan tshun du ltos nas rkyen gyi dbang gis thams cad 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad kyang phan tshun du ltos nas rkyen gyi dbang gis thams cad 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, everything arises through the power of conditions, in mutual dependence.

original: de ni / de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyis 'dir mthong ba yin la mi rtag pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / ther zug ma yin pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i chos rnams ni /🔽gcig kyang skye ba na yod pa ma yin no //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus kyis lus la rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: de ni / de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyis 'dir mthong ba yin la mi rtag pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / ther zug ma yin pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i chos rnams ni / gcig kyang skye ba na yod pa ma yin no // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus kyis lus la rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also see that the phenomena of impermanence, instability, non-durability, and changeability do not arise in any way.

original: ji ltar dzambu'i gling pa'i mi rnams kyi tshe thung ba dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: ji ltar dzambu'i gling pa'i mi rnams kyi tshe thung ba dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the external body will also wonder about the lifespan of the people of Jambudvīpa.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice that

original: gang gi tshe bzang ldan gyi dus kyi mi rnams thams cad ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bzang ldan gyi dus kyi mi rnams thams cad ni /
translated: the people of Jambudvīpa have short lifespans.

original: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris las babs par gyur pa rnams yin pas sa zhag zas yin te /
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris las babs par gyur pa rnams yin pas sa zhag zas yin te /
translated: When the people of Bhadraṃkara descend from the realm of the luminous gods, they will eat earth and clay.

original: dper na / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi zas ni /
analyzed: dper na / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi zas ni /
translated: For example, the food of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three is like the finest rice.

original: bdud rtsi yin pa de bzhin du dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i bzang ldan gyi dus kyi mi rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: bdud rtsi yin pa de bzhin du dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i bzang ldan gyi dus kyi mi rnams kyis ni /
translated: Just as it is with nectar, so it is with the good people who have a virtuous mind.

original: sa'i bcud mdog dang / dri dang / gzugs dang / reg bya bzang ba /
analyzed: sa'i bcud mdog dang / dri dang / gzugs dang / reg bya bzang ba /
translated: The essence of the earth has a good color, smell, form and touch.

original: skyon rnams thams cad dang bral bar @270b gyur pa'i mi rnams zas rnams kyi dbang gis 'tsho ba yin no //
analyzed: skyon rnams thams cad dang bral bar @270b gyur pa'i mi rnams zas rnams kyi dbang gis 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: People, free from all faults, live by eating food.

original: de'i stobs kyis tshe'i tshad ni /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis tshe'i tshad ni /
translated: By its power, the life span

original: lo stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: is eighty-four thousand years.

original: nad kyang gsum 'byung par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad kyang gsum 'byung par 'gyur ro //
translated: And three diseases arise:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: ltags pa dang / skom pa dang / 'dod pa la ltos nas de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'tsho ba dang nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltags pa dang / skom pa dang / 'dod pa la ltos nas de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'tsho ba dang nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: hunger, thirst and desire. But all of them live and are healthy in relation to these.

original: de nas gnyis ldan gyi dus na ni /
analyzed: de nas gnyis ldan gyi dus na ni /
translated: Then, in the age of two-fold Dharma,

original: sa'i bcud de dag nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur zhing mi rnams kyang de bzhin du sems dge ba'i sems dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i bcud de dag nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur zhing mi rnams kyang de bzhin du sems dge ba'i sems dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the essence of the earth becomes faulty and people do not have a virtuous mind in the same way.

original: nad rnams thams cad kyang mi rnams la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad rnams thams cad kyang mi rnams la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All kinds of diseases will also afflict humans.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: ltogs pa dang / skom pa dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang / tsha ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: ltogs pa dang / skom pa dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang / tsha ba skye ba'o //
translated: hunger, thirst, untimely death, and heat.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi zas rnams kyi dbang gis dzambu'i gling gi mi de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'tsho ba dang nad med par yang 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi zas rnams kyi dbang gis dzambu'i gling gi mi de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'tsho ba dang nad med par yang 'gyur ro // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te / ji ltar na /
translated: In this way, the people of Jambudvīpa will all live and be healthy due to the power of external food.

original: dzambu'i gling pa'i mi rnams thams cad gsum ldan gyi dus na zas kyi dbang gis kha dog dang tshe ji lta bu yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling pa'i mi rnams thams cad gsum ldan gyi dus na zas kyi dbang gis kha dog dang tshe ji lta bu yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers the body and attends to it in this way will continue to wonder, ‘How do the people of Jambudvīpa, due to the power of food, obtain their complexion and lifespan during the time of the three harvests?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,🔽he will then see the following:

original: gsum ldan gyi dus na ni sa'i bcud de dag de bzhin du nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum ldan gyi dus na ni sa'i bcud de dag de bzhin du nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: During the time of the three harvests, the essence of the earth will disappear.

original: nad du ma rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
